com.ibm.team.process.client
Interface IAdvisorProblemResolutionDelegate

public interface IAdvisorProblemResolutionDelegate

Advisor problem resolutions provide "quick fix" functionality for problems detected by operation advisors.

Since:
0.5

Method Summary
 boolean mayBeApplicable(IAdvisorInfo info)
          Returns whether this resolution may be able to resolve the given problem.
 boolean run(IAdvisorInfo info, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
          Runs this delegate and returns whether or not the problem resolution was applied.
 

Method Detail

run

boolean run(IAdvisorInfo info,
            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
Runs this delegate and returns whether or not the problem resolution was applied.

Implementers need not attempt to determine if the problem has been fixed. They need only return whether or not the resolution logic was run.

Parameters:
info - the problem to resolve
monitor - a monitor for reporting progress and checking cancellation or null
Returns:
whether or not the problem resolution was applied
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled

mayBeApplicable

boolean mayBeApplicable(IAdvisorInfo info)
Returns whether this resolution may be able to resolve the given problem. This method should be low cost and may not block indefinitely as it is called on the UI thread.

This method provides an opportunity for implementors to filter the resolution when possible, but this method need not be strictly accurate. Implementations should return true if it would be costly to determine the correct return value.

Parameters:
info - the problem
Returns:
whether or not this resolution may be applicable for the given info
